page.title: 08Penn/Tylers Green Study
page.content: {Penn Village:}Across the road from the {Crown Inn}there is a monument that was a tribute to the men who died in the first world war. The original stocks were by the old Elm tree which is near the monument. There is a farm called {Puttenham Place Farm}which is over 500 years old.Henry the VIII had lots of wives and Catherine stayed at {Puttenham Place Farm. Penn Village merges with{Tylers Green}Village.It is called{Tylers Green}because tiles were made there and the roofs of the houses are made from Clay tiles. In 1796 {Edmund Burke}used a house in a field, since called{French school meadow,}as a school for fatherless children from the French Revolution.The names of the woods are{Chipping,Common, Brook, {Pughs, Vicarage, Twichels and Larches. We are studying{Penn/Tylers Green village as it has very old buildings.
